title: John Kempf: Bringing Regenerative Agriculture into the Mainstream | 9th Soil & Nutrition Conference

tasks.task: Attend a conference to announce an AI Agronomist project.
subtasks: Express enjoyment of the conference and being present.
Introduce the AI Agronomist project as a joint initiative.
State the goal of making regenerative agriculture mainstream by 2040.
Highlight the need for integrated scientific knowledge in agriculture.
Discuss the challenges in hiring and training agronomy team members.
Explain the importance of democratizing and digitizing agricultural information.
Describe the current project's focus on digitizing knowledge and creating algorithms.
Outline the vision for real-time infield data collection using spectrometers.
Discuss the project's historical roots and timeline.
Explain the project's collaboration with other organizations and partners.
Address the importance of soil and plant health in climate resilience.
Describe the impact of cosmic radiation and lunar cycles on agriculture.
Address concerns about the project's impact on microbial dynamics.
Acknowledge the role of soil biology in plant and microbial interactions.
Discuss the process of endophyte colonization and disease suppression.
Address the potential of regenerative agriculture to counteract climate change.
Consider the socio-economic implications and scalability of the project.
Address questions about climate change events and adaptation strategies.
Challenge the notion of "bad guys" in soil biology and propose solutions for toxicity.
